name: medic
description: Medic Mobile combines SMS messaging, data collection, and analytics for health workers and health systems in hard-to-reach areas with or without internet connectivity.
long_description: Medic Mobile is a web based SMS data collection and analytics tool focused on community health care workers in rural environments. We help large health organizations collect and analyze data sent from health care workers using ordinary mobile phones.

locale.title: Locale
locale.description: Default tries to use best option according to browser settings, you can override that here.

locale.title: Default Locale For Website
locale.description: The code of the default locale for users logging in to the website. Can be overridden in user settings. Must be one of the codes specified in Locales above.

locale_outgoing.title: Default Locale For Outgoing Messages
locale_outgoing.description: The code of the default locale for outgoing messages. Must be one of the codes specified in Locales above.

muvuku_webapp_url.title: Medic Reporter URL
muvuku_webapp_url.description: URL for Medic Reporter, a tool to send messages into Medic Mobile from a web interface. Use it to simulate SMS, Medic Collect or Simapp reports.

reported_date_format.title: DateTime Format
reported_date_format.description: Format used to display dates and times.

forms_only_mode.title: Only Expect Forms
forms_only_mode.description: All incoming messages will be parsed as forms. Unstractured messages will be rejected.

default_responses.title: Auto-replies
default_responses.description: When an empty message or badly formatted report is received, an error auto-reply message is sent out. When forms_only_mode is off, received messages will trigger a confirmation auto-reply message. All reply messages are generated based on translation and locale settings.

start_date.title: Start Date
start_date.description: Auto-replies are added to messages received after this date.  If left empty auto-replies are not added.  Use the format YYYY-MM-DD to define the date, for example 2014-03-27.

district_admins_access_unallocated_messa.title: Allow District Admins To View Unallocated Messages
district_admins_access_unallocated_messa.description: If checked/true, district administrators will be able to view messages with no allocated facility as well as messages from their district. If unchecked/false, only admins will see unallocated messages.

default_country_code.title: Default Country Code
default_country_code.description: Messages without a country code will be assigned this country code.

gateway_number.title: Gateway Number
gateway_number.description: This is the number where mobile reporters should send their reports. It is also the number they will receive messages from.  Auto-replies will not be sent to this number to avoid message loops.

outgoing_phone_replace.title: Outgoing Phone Replacement
outgoing_phone_replace.description: Use this to reformat the numbers for outgoing messages. Medic Mobile uses international format for phone numbers, so if your gateway doesn't support it use this setting. Otherwise leave blank.

replace.title: Replace with
replace.description: The value to replace the match with

outgoing_phone_filters.title: Outgoing Phone Filters
outgoing_phone_filters.description: These filters are applied to every phone number on an outgoing message.  This can be useful if your incoming phone number and outgoing phone number formats are slightly different.

match.title: Match
match.description: A regular expression used to match a phone number.  e.g. \+997

replace.title: Replace with
replace.description: Replace the match with this value.

schedule_morning_hours.title: Scheduled Message Morning Hours
schedule_morning_hours.description: Only send messages on or after this hour.

schedule_morning_minutes.title: Scheduled Message Morning Minutes
schedule_morning_minutes.description: Only send messages on or after this minute.

schedule_evening_hours.title: Scheduled Message Evening Hours
schedule_evening_hours.description: Only send messages on or before this hour.

schedule_evening_minutes.title: Scheduled Message Evening Minutes
schedule_evening_minutes.description: Only send messages on or before this minute.

synthetic_date.title: Synthetic date
synthetic_date.description: Only use this if you are testing message scheduling and want to simulate a specific date. e.g. 201304121200

id_format.title: Patient ID Format
id_format.description: Format of generated numerical identifiers. Note, an extra check digit is always used, so the default value (1111) generates a length of 5, e.g. '92345'.

contact_display_short.title: Short Contact Display
contact_display_short.description: How to render the contact name in short format? e.g. clinic.name, clinic.contact.name, clinic.parent.name

statistics_submission.title: Anonymous Statistics Submission
statistics_submission.description: Whether and how to submit anonymous statistics. Valid values: 'none', 'web', 'sms', 'both'

statistics_submission_number.title: Anonymous Statistics Submission SMS Number
statistics_submission_number.description: The phone number to send Anonymous Statistics to.

kujua-reporting.title: Scheduled Reports
kujua-reporting.description: The forms to include in reporting rates stats.

anc_forms.title: ANC Reports
anc_forms.description: Define your ANC related form codes here, these forms will be used to generate analytics.

permissions.title: Permissions
permissions.description: Defines which users can access which features of the webapp.

name.title: Permission
name.description: e.g. can_view_data_records @garethbowen Should this be an enum? Can you make up your own permissions?

roles.title: Roles
roles.description: e.g. ['national_admin', district_admin]. You can edit each user's roles in the config pages of Medic Mobile.

alerts.title: Alerts
alerts.description: Send alert messages when specific conditions are received through reports. E.g. send email to Roberta when we're running out of medicine X.

condition.title: Condition To Send Alerts
condition.description: Alert will be sent when condition is true. Build condition using the notation `form_code(reports_ago).field_id`. E.g.: The following can be used to send an alert if the value of `s1_avail` in form `STCK` falls below the three month average of `s1_used`: "STCK(0).s1_avail < (STCK(0).s1_used + STCK(1).s1_used + STCK(2).s1_used ) / 3".

message.title: Alert Text
message.description: Text that will be sent out in the alert. Variables names can be used. E.g.: {{clinic.name}}, {{s1_name}}.

recipient.title: Send Alerts To
recipient.description: The email or phone number to receive alerts. Can also use variable name to receive alert. E.g.: reporting_unit, parent, grandparent, name@ngo.org, +15559870000

reminders.title: Scheduled Report Reminders
reminders.description: Configure this for forms that should be reported on a repetitive schedule.

form.title: Reminder Form Code
form.description: What form is this reminder for?  e.g. ZDIS

text_expression.title: Reminder Text Configuration
text_expression.description: A text expression definition of the schedule.  See http://bunkat.github.io/later/parsers.html#text e.g. at 9am on Monday

cron.title: Reminder Cron Configuration
cron.description: A cron definition of the schedule. Optional, a text expression will override this.  e.g. weekly on Monday at 9am: '0 9 * * 1'

mute_after_form_for.title: Mute Reminders For
mute_after_form_for.description: After receiving a form, how long to mute reminders for.  Supported units: years, months, weeks, days, hours, minutes. e.g. 5 days

message.title: Reminder Text
message.description: Message to be sent.  The following strings will be substituted into the message: {{week}}, {{year}} and {{form}}.

registrations.title: Report Actions
registrations.description: Actions that can be taken when a report comes in. E.g. validate the report fields, send a reply message, assign an id to the registered patient, assign a schedule (see 'Schedules' section)

form.title: Form
form.description: Form code for which to trigger actions. e.g. ANCR

events.name: Triggered actions
events.description: Trigger specific actions, e.g. a report is created in the system (on_create).

trigger.title: Triggered action
trigger.description: Action triggered when form is received, e.g. enrolling in a schedule.

params.title: Parameters
params.description: i.e. if assigning a schedule provide the name. It has to match an existing schedule name, see 'Schedules' section.

bool_expr.title: Boolean expression
bool_expr.description: If this expression evaluates to false the trigger will be skipped.

validations.description: Specify the contraints that form fields should follow (e.g. patient_name should have more that 3 characters), to reject invalid reports.

join_responses.title: Join Validation Responses
join_responses.description: By default we send one validation response at a time.  Use this option to join or concatenate all validation response messages in one.  Note, like all outgoing messages it will be truncated at 160 characters.

property.title: Property
property.description: The property on the JSON form to validate. e.g. patient_name

rule.title: Validation Rule
rule.description: The validation rule. Backslashes must be double escaped. e.g. lenMin(5) && lenMax(50)

message.title: Response Message
message.description: The response when validation fails. Mustache templating is supported.

content.title: Message Content
content.description: e.g. '{{patient_name}}' is not a valid patient name. Please submit a patient name between 5 and 50 characters.

locale.title: Locale
locale.description: Set the locale if you need to support responses in multiple languages. e.g. en

messages.title: Response Messages
messages.description: When a report is valid, Medic Mobile sends a response message. If the report is invalid, see 'validations'.

locale.title: Locale
locale.description: Set the locale if you need to support responses in multiple languages. e.g. en

recipient.title: Recipient
recipient.description: Contact to recieve the message. Use a field name on registration form or one of the following to reference the facility: reporting_unit, parent, grandparent. e.g. reporting_unit

patient_reports.title: Patient Reports
patient_reports.description: To clear reminder schedules define your visit forms here.

form.title: Report Form
form.description: Form code of the report. e.g. ANCV

silence_type.title: Schedule Name
silence_type.description: Name of reminder schedule(s) to clear after receiving this report.  Name needs to match exactly, e.g. ANC Reminders.  If you need to support clearing multiple schedules then separate the names with commas.

silence_for.title: Silence Window
silence_for.description: The length of time used to find the next reminder group to clear.  Leave blank to clear all reminder groups.  Supported units: years, months, weeks, days, hours, minutes. e.g. 25 days

fields.title: Fields
fields.description: Available field names for use in validations

join_responses.title: Join Validation Responses
join_responses.description: By default we send one validation response at a time.  Use this option to join or concatenate all validation response messages in one.  Note, like all outgoing messages it will be truncated at 160 characters.

schedules.description: Schedules are lists of messages that will be sent out periodically. You can trigger them when specific reports come in, see 'Form Actions'. When a schedule is attached to a report, you will see the list of messages at the bottom of the report in Medic Mobile. Within the schedule, messages are organized in groups. E.g. in a schedule of ANC visit reminders, there is a group of messages for each visit: one message 1 week before, one message on the due date, one message 1 week after. The message groups are cleared by visit reports that are configured in the previous section.
schedules.title: Schedules

name.title: Name
name.description: A unique name to define this schedule. e.g. ANC Reminders

summary.title: Summary
summary.description: A brief summary of this schedule

description.title: Description
description.description: A complete description of this schedule in markdown format

start_from.title: Timestamp Property Name
start_from.description: A timestamp or date property on the record that is used to calculate when messages are sent. e.g. lmp_date.  Use reported_date if you want to reference the date and time the report was received.

locale.title: Locale
locale.description: Set the locale if you need to support responses in multiple languages. e.g. en

group.title: Message Group Number
group.description: You can group messages together by assigning a group number, e.g. 1. Messages in the same group will be cleared together.

offset.title: Send Message After
offset.description: This value is added to the timestamp property value to determine when to send the message.  Supported units: years, months, weeks, days, hours, minutes. e.g. 5 days

send_day.title: Send Day
send_day.description: Optionally specify the nearest day to offset.

send_time.title: Send Time
send_time.description: Specify time of day at which the message is to be sent. Ignored if blank. If timezone offset is not specfiied GMT will be used.  e.g. 20:30 +0300

recipient.title: Recipient
recipient.description: Contact to recieve the message. Use a field name on registration form or one of the following to reference the facility: reporting_unit, parent, grandparent. e.g. reporting_unit

notifications.title: Notifications
notifications.description: Define the forms that are used to enable or disable all scheduled messages for a reporter/recipient.

off_form.title: Stop Notifications Form
off_form.description: When receiving a form of this type, stop sending notifications. e.g. OFF

on_form.title: Resume Notifications Form
on_form.description: When receiving a form of this type, resume sending notifications. e.g. ON

confirm_deactivation.title: Confirm Muting Notifications?
confirm_deactivation.description: Disable stopping of notification based on form submission, administrators are notified instead.

tasks.title: Task Generation
tasks.description: Starting v2.6.0, Medic Mobile computes tasks and targets for each user. Tasks are actions the user has to do (e.g. go see Marie and remind her the ANC visit is due.). Targets are visualization of how far they are in their monthly goals (e.g. register 5 new patients this month).

rules.title: Rules
rules.description: Tasks and targets are defined by set a Nools DSL rules. The rules define the events, and the 'Tasks' and 'Targets' config define when and how the tasks are diplayed.

type.title: Type of statistic
type.description: 'Count' is for targets in absolute numbers, e.g 5 new patients registered. 'Percent' is for percent targets, e.g. 75% of deliveries happened at a facility.

name.title: Title
name.description: Title of this target displayed to the user.

icon.title: Icon
icon.description: The id of the icon to show to the user. You can upload icons in Medic Mobile's configuration pages.

goal.title: Goal value
goal.description: E.g. for a goal of 5 new patients, enter 5. For 75% of safe deliveries, enter 75.

schedules.title: Schedules
schedules.description: Tasks that are displayed to users (e.g. immunize a baby). They can be resolved by taking certain actions (e.g. immunizing the baby), or expire after a given time (e.g. when the next immunization is due).

events.title: Events
events.description: The schedule of tasks to generate

days.title: Number of days after event that task is due

start.title: Number of days before due date to show task

end.title: Number of days after due date to show task

title.title: Title
title.description: User-displayed title of the task. Mustache templating is supported

description.title: Description
description.description: User-displayed description of the task. Mustache templating is supported
